=== Inheritance of Power ===
  +
{{main|Gamal Mubarak}}
  +   +
The grooming of Gamal Mubarak to be his father's successor as the next president of Egypt became increasingly evident at around the year 2000.<ref>Aziz, Muhammad Abdul and Hussein, Youssef (2002) "The President, the Son, and the Military: Succession in Egypt" ''Arab Studies Journal'' 9/10: pp. 73–88</ref> With no vice-president, and with no heir-apparent in sight, Gamal started enjoying considerable attention in the Egyptian media.<ref>Brownlee, Jason (2008) [https://webspace.utexas.edu/jmb334/www/documents/article.ASJ.2008.pdf "The Heir Apparency of Gamal Mubarak"] ''Arab Studies Journal'' pp. 36–56</ref> [[Bashar al-Asad]]'s rise to power in [[Syria]] in June 2000 just hours after [[Hafez al-Asad]]'s death, sparked a heated debate in the Egyptian press regarding the prospects for a similar scenario occurring in Cairo.<ref>Sobelman, Daniel (2001) [http://www.meforum.org/27/gamal-mubarak-president-of-egypt "Gamal Mubarak, President of Egypt?"] ''Middle East Quarterly'' 8(2): pp. 31–40</ref>
  +   +
Both President Mubarak and his son denied the possibility of any inheritance of power in Egypt, although this was widely speculated. Most recently, this claim was made in early 2006, when Gamal Mubarak declared repeatedly that he has no aspiration to succeed his father, but that he will maintain his position in the NDP as deputy secretary general, a post he holds in addition to heading the party's policy committee, probably the most important organ of the NDP.<ref>[http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/egypt/?id=16096 http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/egypt/?id=16096] <font color="blue">deadlink, 9 November 2010</font></ref>
  +   +
In September 2004 several political groups (most are unofficial), on both the left and the right, announced their sharp opposition to the inheritance of power. They demanded political change and asked for a fair election with more than one candidate.<ref>[http://mengos.net/events/04newsevents/egypt/september/9september04.htm http://mengos.net/events/04newsevents/egypt/september/9september04.htm]<font color="blue">deadlink, 9 November 2010</font></ref>
